newsitem.title: UK: World 95/96 coffee exports seen at 72.5 mln bags.
newsitem.headline: World 95/96 coffee exports seen at 72.5 mln bags.

text.p: British trade house E D & F Man said world 1995/96 (Oct-Sept) coffee exports could reach around 72.5 million 60-kg bags, a 7.1 million bag rise over 1994/95.

Exports from the region of Central America and Mexico had been particularly strong, with regional sales of around 15.9 million bags, 3.3 million above the previous year and some 700,000 bags above the previous record high in 1989/90, it said.
"This is due to extremely strong shipments from Mexico and Guatemala," it said in a monthly report.
There is also a great deal of optimism about the Asian robusta coffee crop, Man said.
"The Indonesian crop is now well sold, but strong arrivals at the tail of the crop has pushed estimates of the 1996/97 crop up to 7.3-7.5 million bags," it said.
This is sharply up from 1995/96 crop of around 6.2 million, it said.
Man said good weather and high grower prices over the last three years would provide Vietnam with a bumper crop.
"It is expected that the Vietnamese crop out-turn will be around 4.5 million bags," it said. This compares with a production of around 3.5 million in 1995/96.
